newsitem.title: USA: BEFORE THE BELL - Hewlett-Packard pounded.
newsitem.headline: BEFORE THE BELL - Hewlett-Packard pounded.

text.p: Hewlett-Packard Co's stock fell sharply preceding Friday's U.S. market open, the stock in disfavor after the company reported quarterly earnings below Wall Street forecasts, traders said.
In early third market trade, Hewlett-Packard was trading at 53-3/4, down from 58-7/8 at Thursday's New York Stock Exchange close.

After last night's closing bell, the company said it earned $0.75 per share in the period ended April 30, $0.05 short of the First Call analysts consensus estimate but above the $0.69 per share netted in the year-ago quarter.
The company's results shook confidence in technology stocks, traders said, with an early slip in International Business Machines among the related declines.
IBM edged 3/8 lower to 173-1/2 ahead of the market open, while Intel fell to 157-1/2 from 158-1/8, Gateway 2000 declined 1-1/2 to 67-3/8 and Sun Microsystems Inc lost one to 32.
Netscape Communications Corp shares tumbled to 30-3/4 from 34-9/16 in a selloff driven by the company's warning yesterday of slower earnings and revenue growth due to higher spending, traders said.
The outlook initially was made in Netscape's 10-Q filing with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission.
Also, Adobe Systems dropped to 42 from 44-5/16, Cisco Systems fell one to 61-3/4 and Microsoft shed one to 116-1/8.
